bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Richard Doughty Johnson was born on August 31, 1932 in Detroit, Michigan, to Henry Arnold and Mary Ruth Doughty Johnson. After graduating from Cass Technical High School in Detroit in 1951, he earned a Bachelor of Science (1958) and Masters of Urban Planning (1968) from Michigan State University. From 1964 to 1965, Johnson was city planner for the New Haven, Connecticut, City Plan Commission.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Approximately 280 slides, taken by Richard D. Johnson in 1964-1965, of various housing projects, schools, parks, streets, and buildings in New Haven, Connecticut. Includes some Yale University buildings.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.
The entire collection is available in digital form in the Manuscripts and Archives digital image database. To see original slides, patrons must receive permission from the reference archivist.
